00005 #include <nacl/npupp.h>
00006 
00007 // These functions are called when a module instance is first loaded, and when
00008 // the module instance is finally deleted.  They must use C-style linkage.
00009 
00010 extern "C" {
00011 
00012 // Populates |plugin_funcs| by calling InitializePluginFunctions.
00013 // Declaration: npupp.h
00014 // Web Reference: N/A
00015 NPError NP_GetEntryPoints(NPPluginFuncs* plugin_funcs) {
00016   extern NPError InitializePluginFunctions(NPPluginFuncs* plugin_funcs);
00017   return InitializePluginFunctions(plugin_funcs);
00018 }
00019 
00020 // Some platforms, including Native Client, use the two-parameter version of
00021 // NP_Initialize(), and do not call NP_GetEntryPoints().  Others (Mac, e.g.)
00022 // use single-parameter version of NP_Initialize(), and then call
00023 // NP_GetEntryPoints() to get the NPP functions.  Also, the NPN entry points
00024 // are defined by the Native Client loader, but are not defined in the trusted
00025 // plugin loader (and must be filled in in NP_Initialize()).
00026 
00027 // Called when the first instance of this plugin is first allocated to
00028 // initialize global state.  The browser is hereby telling the plugin its
00029 // interface in |browser_functions| and expects the plugin to populate
00030 // |plugin_functions| in return.  Memory allocated by this function may only
00031 // be cleaned up by NP_Shutdown.
00032 // returns an NPError if anything went wrong.
00033 // Declaration: npupp.h
00034 // Documentation URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/NP_Initialize
00035 NPError NP_Initialize(NPNetscapeFuncs* browser_functions,
00036                       NPPluginFuncs* plugin_functions) {
00037   return NP_GetEntryPoints(plugin_functions);
00038 }
00039 
00040 // Called just before the plugin itself is completely unloaded from the
00041 // browser.  Should clean up anything allocated by NP_Initialize.
00042 // Declaration: npupp.h
00043 // Documentation URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/NP_Shutdown
00044 NPError NP_Shutdown() {
00045   return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00046 }
00047 
00048 }  // extern "C"
